Explanation: Since no further boundary interventions occur and the equation is time-independent (Laplace's equation), the solution \\(\\phi(t,x)\\) in the domain will remain static after its initial determination from \\(h(0, x)\\). The solution follows from the initial boundary condition and isn't affected by time.
